param.dialogReference: Band 7 raster data from landsat 8 (short wave infrared 1, 2.11 - 2.29 micrometer)

param.name: DEM
param.dialogReference: a digital elevation model that covers similar geographic extent as the landsat data

param.name: hot_pix
param.dialogReference: a shapefile drawn around "hot" non-irrigated areas in the area covered by landsat data

param.name: cold_pix
param.dialogReference: a shapefile drawn around "cold" irrigated areas where evapotranspiration is expected to be high

param.name: wx_file
param.dialogReference: the filepath to a file containing weather data at a station very near to, or inside of the area of interest. See help documentation for how to obtain weather data in the proper format.

param.name: crop
param.dialogReference: This should be "alfalfa", support for "grass" may be added later.

param.name: workspace
param.displayname: Workspace to store intermediates and outputs (full path to a NEW directory)
param.dialogReference: This must be a desired path to a NEW folder that metric will create. METRIC writes many files, and requires some empty template files that must be coppied from their templates. All this new data wil be stored in the "workspace" along with all outputs from METRIC.

param.name: wx_elevation
param.displayname: manual elevation of weather station (in meters)
param.dialogReference: The elevation of the weather station

param.name: wx_zom
param.displayname: manual roughness length (zom) estimate at weather station location
param.dialogReference:
momentum roughness length estimate of the weather stations locaton.

Usually, since weather stations must be in relatively open areas, their zoms may be estimated fairly accurately. For very arid climates where the weather staion is likely surrounded by dirt and sparse shrubs, the minimum value of 0.005 should be used here. For less arid regions with healthy grasses surrounding the weather stations, a maximum value of 0.018 should be used here. If left blank, this value defaults to 0.010

param.name: LE_cold_cal_factor
param.dialogReference:
A factor by which reference LE is mutliplied to obtain LE_cold. Defaults to 1.05

METRIC internally calibrates with an Latent Energy (LE) value for the reference cold pixels. This LE value emperically tends to be 105% of the reference LE, but may not be in every conceivable scenario.

param.name: mounts
param.dialogReference: Mountainous terrian has some adjustments made to aerodynamic transport terms when calculating sensible heat. Please check this box if the terrain would be considered mountainous.

param.name: saveflag
param.displayname: Save_flag (decides which variables to save to hard disk)
param.dialogReference:
Simple way to reduce processing time and save disk space for large datasets (larger than about half of a landsat scene).

"ALL" will save every single intermediate output for step by step follow along with the calculations performed by METRIC, which is usefull for troubleshooting. Requires a very large amount of disc space.

"LIMITED" will save all final and intermediate solution variables, but not every single layer of iteratively solved parameters. This is the recomended saveflag.

"ET-ONLY" will only save the Evapotranspiration related outputs, NDVI, SAVI, LAI, and latent energy.

param.name: recalc
param.dialogReference:
recalc = True: will force all intermediate values to be recalculated, even if they have already been saved to disk.

recalc = False: will allow a model that has already been run before to pick up appropriate intermediate calculations to save processing time. Slope and aspect are examples of datasets that will be recycled with recalc = False.

param.name: l_green_fac
param.dialogReference: Reference L factor for calculating SAVI. Value shoud be between 0.1 and 0.5, with 0.1 being valid for arid climates like Idaho, and 0.5 being typical for well vegetated climates.
